ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The identification_item type is an extensible list of alternate data types. It provides a mechanism to refer to instances of the data types included in the types that extend the identification_item type.
This empty extensible select requires extension in a further module to ensure that all entities have at least one valid instantiation.

The versionable_item type is an extensible list of alternate data types. It provides a mechanism to refer to instances of the data types included in the types that extend the versionable_item type.
The versionable_item type is primarily defined to collect all the entity data types to which a version identifier can be added using applied_identification_assignment.
An applied_identification_assignment is a type of identification_assignment that assigns an identifier to a set of instances of the entity types listed in identification_item.
the set of items to which the identification is assigned.

The version_assignment_is_valid function evaluates whether an instance of applied_identification_assignment whose identification role is 'version', contains, in its items attribute, only instances of types listed in versionable_item.
The function returns TRUE is the role is not 'version' or if the items attribute only contains instances of types listed in versionable_item or in its extensions.
the instance of applied_identification_assignment, the validity of which is assessed.

The version_assignments_are_valid rule ensures that all instances of applied_identification_assignment whose identification role is 'version', contain, in their items attribute, only instances of types listed in versionable_item.
There shall not be any instance of applied_identification_assignment that provides a version identifier to an instance of an entity not listed in versionable_item.
